skill.name: commit-message-generator
skill.description: Generate appropriate commit messages based on Git diffs
skill.summary: Generate appropriate commit messages based on Git diffs
skill.author: Daisuke897

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill providing commit message generation guidance. The skill only suggests git commands but never executes them. All static findings are false positives: git commands are legitimate for this use case, backticks are documentation formatting, and hash/URL patterns are metadata artifacts.

content.user_title: Generate commit messages from Git diffs
content.value_statement: Writing clear, consistent commit messages takes time and discipline. This skill analyzes your Git diffs and generates Conventional Commits messages that follow established conventions. The AI examines changed files and creates meaningful commit headers with bulleted change summaries.
actual_capabilities: Analyze git diff output to understand code changes
Suggest commit splitting for multi-concern changes
Provide git add and commit commands for execution
Review git status to identify modified files
limitations: Does not execute git commands on your behalf
Cannot access repositories without explicit git diff output
Messages are generated in English only
Does not handle git merge commits or complex histories

use_cases.title: Maintain clean commit history
use_cases.description: Generate professional commit messages for pull requests that follow project conventions and make code review easier.

use_cases.title: Accelerate code reviews
use_cases.description: Create clear commit messages that help teammates understand what changed and why without reading every line of diff.

use_cases.title: Build better habits
use_cases.description: Learn Conventional Commits patterns while working on personal projects to maintain organized project history.

prompt_templates.title: Basic usage
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the git diff and generate a Conventional Commits message following the skill guidelines.

prompt_templates.title: Multiple changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Review all changes and suggest how to split them into atomic commits with separate Conventional Commits messages.

prompt_templates.title: Feature and refactor
prompt_templates.prompt: Identify which changes are new features versus refactoring. Generate separate commits for each concern with appropriate Conventional Commits types.

prompt_templates.title: Complex diffs
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform thorough analysis of the complete diff. Identify all logical groups of changes, explain the rationale for splitting, and provide each commit message with target files and suggested git commands.

output_examples.input: Analyze this git diff and generate commit messages
output: feat(auth): add TypeScript types for user authentication module
- Add UserProfile interface with id, email, and role fields
- Create AuthResult type with success boolean and user property
- Export types from main authentication module

output_examples.input: Review my staged and unstaged changes
output: fix: correct typo in error message on line 42
- Fix 'Unkown' to 'Unknown' in validation error text

output_examples.input: I have feature and refactoring changes mixed together
output: feat(api): add new endpoint for user preferences
- Add preferences service with CRUD methods
- Move validation helpers to shared utils module
- Update existing endpoints to use shared validators

best_practices: Provide complete git diff output including staged and unstaged changes for accurate analysis
Review suggested commit messages before executing git commands
Use the skill for learning Conventional Commits patterns over time
anti_patterns: Blindly running suggested git commands without reviewing the messages
Asking for commit messages without providing git diff context
Ignoring the skill's guidance on when to split commits

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each tool may have slight interaction differences.

faq.question: What is the maximum diff size?
faq.answer: Very large diffs may be truncated by the AI. Consider splitting into multiple requests for extensive changes.

faq.question: Can I use this with GitHub CLI?
faq.answer: Yes. Provide git diff output from gh or git CLI. The skill focuses on message generation, not the CLI tool used.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads git diff output you provide. Code never leaves your session or machine.

faq.question: Why are my messages in English?
faq.answer: The skill is designed for Conventional Commits which specify English headers. This maintains compatibility with most projects.

faq.question: How is this different from git commit hooks?
faq.answer: This skill generates messages for you to review. Git hooks enforce formatting. Use together for best results.
